caption.p: ( a) Dendogram of the EO constituents of O. vulgare from this study and from literature reports (the samples are marked according to Table 5); ( b) correlation network based on O. vulgare EO constituents (P-CYM— p-cymene; THY—thymol; CRV—carvacrol; SAB—sabinene; G-TER— γ-terpinene; 1,8-CIN—1,8-cineole; LIN—linalool; A-TER— α-terpineol; B-CIT— β-citronellol; LIN-A—linalyl acetate; B-CAR— β-caryophyllene; GER-D—germacrene D; CAR-O—caryophyllene oxide).
